parameters.description: The unique identifier of a event
parameters.name: eventId

schema.description: The unique identifier of a event

parameters.description: The potential hijacker AS of a BGP hijack event
parameters.name: hijackerAsn

schema.description: The potential hijacker AS of a BGP hijack event

parameters.description: The potential victim AS of a BGP hijack event
parameters.name: victimAsn

schema.description: The potential victim AS of a BGP hijack event

parameters.description: The potential hijacker or victim AS of a BGP hijack event
parameters.name: involvedAsn

schema.description: The potential hijacker or victim AS of a BGP hijack event

parameters.description: The country code of the potential hijacker or victim AS of a BGP hijack event
parameters.name: involvedCountry

schema.description: The country code of the potential hijacker or victim AS of a BGP hijack event

parameters.description: The minimum confidence score to filter events (1-4 low, 5-7 mid, 8+ high)
parameters.name: minConfidence

schema.description: The minimum confidence score to filter events (1-4 low, 5-7 mid, 8+ high)

parameters.description: The maximum confidence score to filter events (1-4 low, 5-7 mid, 8+ high)
parameters.name: maxConfidence

schema.description: The maximum confidence score to filter events (1-4 low, 5-7 mid, 8+ high)

parameters.description: Shorthand date ranges for the last X days - use when you don't need specific start and end dates.
parameters.name: dateRange

schema.description: Shorthand date ranges for the last X days - use when you don't need specific start and end dates.

GET /radar/bgp/ips/timeseries.description: Get time series data for the announced IP space count, represented as the number of IPv4 /24s and IPv6 /48s, for a given ASN.

parameters.description: Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
parameters.name: name

schema.description: Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.

parameters.description: For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
parameters.name: dateRange

schema.description: For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).

parameters.description: Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
parameters.name: dateStart

schema.description: Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.

parameters.description: Array of comma separated list of ASNs, start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-174, 3356` excludes results from AS174, but includes results from AS3356.
parameters.name: asn

schema.description: Array of comma separated list of ASNs, start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-174, 3356` excludes results from AS174, but includes results from AS3356.

GET /radar/bgp/ips/timeseries.summary: Get BGP IP space time series

GET /radar/bgp/leaks/events.description: Get the BGP route leak events (Beta).

parameters.description: The unique identifier of a event
parameters.name: eventId

schema.description: The unique identifier of a event

parameters.description: The leaking AS of a route leak event
parameters.name: leakAsn

schema.description: The leaking AS of a route leak event

parameters.description: ASN that is causing or affected by a route leak event
parameters.name: involvedAsn

schema.description: ASN that is causing or affected by a route leak event

parameters.description: Country code of a involved ASN in a route leak event
parameters.name: involvedCountry

schema.description: Country code of a involved ASN in a route leak event

parameters.description: Shorthand date ranges for the last X days - use when you don't need specific start and end dates.
parameters.name: dateRange

schema.description: Shorthand date ranges for the last X days - use when you don't need specific start and end dates.

GET /radar/bgp/routes/ases.description: List all ASes in current global routing tables with routing statistics

parameters.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.
parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.

parameters.description: Return order results by given type
parameters.name: sortBy

schema.description: Return order results by given type

parameters.description: Sort by value ascending or descending
parameters.name: sortOrder

schema.description: Sort by value ascending or descending

country.description: 2-letter country code for the AS's registration country

ipv4Count.description: number of IPv4 addresses originated by the AS

ipv6Count.description: number of IPv6 addresses originated by the AS

pfxsCount.description: number of total IP prefixes originated by the AS

rpkiInvalid.description: number of RPKI invalid prefixes originated by the AS

rpkiUnknown.description: number of RPKI unknown prefixes originated by the AS

rpkiValid.description: number of RPKI valid prefixes originated by the AS

dataTime.description: the timestamp of when the data is generated

totalPeers.description: total number of route collector peers used to generate this data

GET /radar/bgp/routes/ases.summary: List ASes from global routing tables

GET /radar/bgp/routes/moas.description: List all Multi-Origin AS (MOAS) prefixes on the global routing tables.

parameters.description: Lookup MOASes originated by the given ASN
parameters.name: origin

schema.description: Lookup MOASes originated by the given ASN

GET /radar/bgp/routes/pfx2as.description: Lookup prefix-to-ASN mapping on global routing tables.

parameters.description: Lookup prefixes originated by the given ASN
parameters.name: origin

schema.description: Lookup prefixes originated by the given ASN

parameters.description: Return only results with matching rpki status: valid, invalid or unknown
parameters.name: rpkiStatus

schema.description: Return only results with matching rpki status: valid, invalid or unknown

parameters.description: Return only results with the longest prefix match for the given prefix. For example, specify a /32 prefix to lookup the origin ASN for an IPv4 address.
parameters.name: longestPrefixMatch

schema.description: Return only results with the longest prefix match for the given prefix. For example, specify a /32 prefix to lookup the origin ASN for an IPv4 address.

GET /radar/bgp/routes/stats.description: Get the BGP routing table stats (Beta).

GET /radar/bgp/timeseries.description: Get BGP updates change over time. Raw values are returned. When requesting updates for an autonomous system (AS), only BGP updates of type announcement are returned.

parameters.description: Aggregation interval results should be returned in (for example, in 15 minutes or 1 hour intervals). Refer to [Aggregation intervals](https://developers.cloudflare.com/radar/concepts/aggregation-intervals/).
parameters.name: aggInterval

schema.description: Aggregation interval results should be returned in (for example, in 15 minutes or 1 hour intervals). Refer to [Aggregation intervals](https://developers.cloudflare.com/radar/concepts/aggregation-intervals/).

GET /radar/bgp/top/ases.description: Get the top autonomous systems (ASes) by BGP updates (announcements only). Values are a percentage out of the total updates.

GET /radar/bgp/top/ases/prefixes.description: Get the full list of autonomous systems on the global routing table ordered by announced prefixes count. The data comes from public BGP MRT data archives and updates every 2 hours.

parameters.description: Maximum number of ASes to return
parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of ASes to return

GET /radar/bgp/top/ases/prefixes.summary: Get list of ASNs ordered by prefix count
